params.taskDescription:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>E</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">E</annotation></semantics></math> is the event “the card is an ace” and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>F</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">F</annotation></semantics></math> is the event “the card is a king.”

    <mo>♡</mo>

questionSetStimulus:
Suppose you’re about to draw one card from a deck containing only these 10 cards: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>A</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{A}}♡</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>A</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♠</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{A}}♠</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>A</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♣</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{A}}♣</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>A</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mi mathvariant="normal">♢<!-- ♢ --></mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{A}}\diamondsuit</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>K</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♠</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{K}}♠</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>K</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♣</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{K}}♣</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>Q</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{Q}}♡</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>Q</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♠</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{Q}}♠</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>J</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{J}}♡</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>J</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♠</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\text{J}}♠</annotation></semantics></math>. Decide whether these events are mutually exclusive:
